Define what constitutes the substring "01" in the context of a binary string.
Analyze the implications of leading zeros and how they affect the formation of the "01" substring.
Determine the structure of a string that results in the appearance of the "01" substring exactly m times.
Consider the logical segmentation of the string into distinct blocks that contribute individually to the count of "01" substrings.
Formulate a recurrence relation or direct formula that relates the presence of m "01" substrings to the length of the string n.
Explore the boundary conditions: What happens when m is 0 or when m approaches its maximum limit relative to n.
Apply combinatorial methods or other mathematical tools to count the number of valid strings fitting the criteria of exactly m "01" substrings.
Verify the formulated approach or solution by checking specific small values of n and m.

Sum the valid combinations from the two cases of starting digits across the string length.
Formulate the general expression that calculates the total counts for strings of length n containing the substring "01" exactly m times.
